sen.j: 吉川 経高（きっかわ つねたか、天福 (日本)2年/文暦元年（1234年） - 文保3年/元応元年（1319年））は鎌倉時代末期の武士。
sen.e: Tsunetaka KIKKAWA (1234 to 1319) was a samurai who lived in the end of Kamakura period.
Tsunetaka KIKKAWA (1234 - 1319) was a samurai who lived in the end of Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 年号を「to」から「ー」でつなぐフォーマットに変更しました。
sen.e: Tsunetaka KIKKAWA (1234 - 1319) was a samurai who lived in the end of Kamakura period.
His father was Tsunemitsu KIKKAWA.
His father was Tsunemitsu KIKKAWA.
His father was Tsunemitsu KIKKAWA.

sen.j: 子に吉川経盛、吉川経長、吉川経頼。
sen.e: His children were Tsunemori KIKKAWA, Tsunenaga KIKKAWA and Tsuneyori KIKKAWA.
His children were Tsunemori KIKKAWA, Tsunenaga KIKKAWA and Tsuneyori KIKKAWA.
His children were Tsunemori KIKKAWA, Tsunenaga KIKKAWA and Tsuneyori KIKKAWA.
His childhood name was 手子熊丸.
sen.cmt: 読みが特定できません。
sen.e: His childhood name was Tegokumamaru.
sen.cmt: こちらも特定できませんでしたが、推定で訳しています。
sen.e: His childhood name was Tegokumamaru.
His official court rank was Izu no kami (Governor of Izu Province).
His official court rank was Izu no kami (Governor of Izu Province).
His official court rank was Izu no kami (Governor of Izu Province).

sen.j: 事実上の吉川氏の祖である。
sen.e: He was practically the founder of the Kikkawa clan.
He was practically the founder of the Kikkawa clan.
He was practically the founder of the Kikkawa clan.

sen.j: 1267年に父・吉川経光から家督を相続。
sen.e: In 1267, he inherited the family estate from Tsunemitsu KIKKAWA, who was his father.
In 1267, he inherited the family estate from his father, Tsunemitsu KIKKAWA.
sen.cmt: 原文の語順に合わせたため単純な文章が関係代名詞でつないだものになっています。修正しました。
sen.e: In 1267, he inherited the family estate from his father, Tsunemitsu KIKKAWA.

sen.j: この頃の吉川氏は本領の駿河国だけではなく、安芸国や播磨国にも所領を抱えていた。
sen.e: Around that time, the Kikkawa clan also had shoryo (territory) in Aki and Harima Provinces other than honryo (main domain) in Suruga Province.
Around that time, the Kikkawa clan also owned shoryo (territory) in Aki and Harima Provinces other than honryo (main domain) in Suruga Province.
sen.cmt: 所領を抱えるを「had」とすると単純すぎると思います。「own」としました。
sen.e: Around that time, the Kikkawa clan also owned shoryo (territory) in Aki and Harima Provinces other than honryo (main domain) in Suruga Province.

sen.j: しかしその管理が不十分であり、所領を横領される等の事件が相次いだ。
sen.e: But those shoryo were taken one after another as a result of improper management.
However, some of those shoryos were misappropriated by others because of the lack of proper management.
sen.cmt: 文頭に接続詞である「But」が来るのは良くないですので、「however」としました。また横領の意味を強くするため、「taken」ではなく「misappropriated」としました。
sen.e: However, some of those shoryos were misappropriated by others because of the lack of proper management.

sen.j: そのため1313年、吉川経高は鎌倉幕府に所領の返還を求めた。
sen.e: In 1313, Tsunetaka KIKKAWA petitioned Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) to return the shoryo.
In 1313, Tsunetaka KIKKAWA petitioned Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) to return those misappropriated shoryos.
sen.cmt: 説明不足と感じましたので多少説明となる語を加えました。
sen.e: In 1313, Tsunetaka KIKKAWA petitioned Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) to return those misappropriated shoryos.

sen.j: その訴えが認められると、80歳近い老躯をおして、総領の経高は本領の駿河を離れ、安芸国大朝町に移住した。
sen.e: After his petition was granted, Tsunetaka, who was the eldest child, left the honryo of Suruga and moved to Oasa town in Aki Province despite his age of nearly 80.
After the petition was granted, Tsunetaka left the honryo of Suruga Province and moved to Oasa town in Aki Province as the eldest son of the family to unify the clan despite his age nearing to 80.
sen.cmt: 総領を「oldest child」とすると「長男が頭領である」という意味が消えてしまいますので修正しました。その他、ご順を修正し文章の分割を避けました。
sen.e: After the petition was granted, Tsunetaka left the honryo of Suruga Province and moved to Oasa town in Aki Province as the eldest son of the family to unify the clan despite his age nearing to 80.

sen.j: 中央情勢に左右されやすく、また弱小の御家人では関東近隣での生き残りが難しいと考えたためと推測される。
sen.e: Probably, this is because he thought it was difficult to survive in the Kanto region under much influence of the central government and as a small gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods).

Tsunetaka might have tried to avoid difficulties of surviving in Kanto region as a small gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods), under a direct influence of the central government.
sen.cmt: Probabllyはだいぶ口語調ですので修正しました。ここでも御純修正を行っています。
sen.e: Tsunetaka might have tried to avoid difficulties of surviving in Kanto region as a small gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods), under a direct influence of the central government.

sen.j: ただ、駿河には末弟の吉川経時を置き、その他の所領も、播磨国福井荘を弟の吉川経盛 (播磨国)（播磨吉川氏）に与え、石見国津淵荘の地頭職を弟の吉川経茂に（後に吉川経家らの一族を出す「石見吉川氏」）、弟の吉川経信 (初代)には大朝まで同行させ、大朝の一部を与えて自身の補佐とした。
sen.e: However, he located Tsunetoki KIKKAWA, who was his youngest brother, in Suruga, gave Fukui no sho (manor) in Harima Province to Tsunemori KIKKAWA (KIKKAWA clan in Harima Province), who was one of his younger brothers, appointed Tsuneshige KIKKAWA ('KIKKAWA clan in Iwami Province' that later produced Tsuneie KIKKAWA and other family members), who was another one of his younger brothers, as jito shiki (manager and lord of a private estate) of Tsubuchi no sho in Iwami Province, and ordered Tsunenobu Kikkawa (first generation), who was another one of his younger brothers, to accompany him to Oasa, gave him a part of Oasa, and made him his assistant.

Tsunetaka posted his youngest brother Tsunetoki KIKKAWA to Suruga, gave Fukui no sho (manor) in Harima Province to one of his younger brothers Tsunemori KIKKAWA (KIKKAWA clan in Harima Province), appointed another one of his younger brothers Tsuneshige KIKKAWA ('KIKKAWA clan in Iwami Province' that later produced Tsuneie KIKKAWA and other family members) as jito shiki (manager and lord of a private estate) of Tsubuchi no sho in Iwami Province, and accompanied another one of his younger brothers Tsunenobu Kikkawa (first generation) to Oasa to give him a part of Oasa and make him assist his work.
sen.cmt: 文頭の「ただ、」は英文で訳す必要はないと思います。略しました。「置く」を「located」とすると「〜の中から探し当てる」などの別の意味も持ってしまうため、配置の意味を示すものとして「posted」としました。その他、各弟の説明を関係代名詞で区切っていましたが、分割せずに言える方法に修正しました。
sen.e: Tsunetaka posted his youngest brother Tsunetoki KIKKAWA to Suruga, gave Fukui no sho (manor) in Harima Province to one of his younger brothers Tsunemori KIKKAWA (KIKKAWA clan in Harima Province), appointed another one of his younger brothers Tsuneshige KIKKAWA ('KIKKAWA clan in Iwami Province' that later produced Tsuneie KIKKAWA and other family members) as jito shiki (manager and lord of a private estate) of Tsubuchi no sho in Iwami Province, and accompanied another one of his younger brothers Tsunenobu Kikkawa (first generation) to Oasa to give him a part of Oasa and make him assist his work.

sen.j: 大朝に入ると駿河丸城を築城し、居城とした。
sen.e: After he moved to Oasa, he built Surugamaru-jo Castle and lived there.
After he moved to Oasa, he built Surugamaru-jo Castle and lived there.
After he moved to Oasa, he built Surugamaru-jo Castle and lived there.

sen.j: 1319年に家督を嫡男の経盛に譲り、同年86歳の高齢で没する。
sen.e: In 1319, he handed over his family estate to Tsunemori, who was his legitimate son, and died the same year at the age of as old as 86.
In 1319, Tsunetaka handed over his family headship to his legitimate son Tsunemori, and died the same year at the ripe old age of 86.
sen.cmt: 訳文では「家督」を所領をゆずることで与えると訳していますが、前項目から推測されるように全部の所領を一人に譲ったかどうかは定かではありません。純粋に家長たる立場を譲ったという訳にしました。
sen.e: In 1319, Tsunetaka handed over his family headship to his legitimate son Tsunemori, and died the same year at the ripe old age of 86.

sen.j: 吉川氏を安芸国に移住させることによって、後の吉川氏の発展と、その名と血脈を現代まで残すことに成功した功労者と言えよう。
sen.e: It may be fair to say that he was distinguished in that, by transferring the KIKKAWA clan to Aki Province, he successfully ensured welfare of the Kikkawa clan and retained the name and lineage of the clan into the modern era.

It may be fair to say that his decision of transferring to Aki Province contributed greatly to establish the foundation for the growth of KIKKAWA clan that retained its name and lineage of the family into modern era.
sen.cmt: 原文の語順にあわせたため、訳文は分割され主題が見えにくくなっています。修正しました。
sen.e: It may be fair to say that his decision of transferring to Aki Province contributed greatly to establish the foundation for the growth of KIKKAWA clan that retained its name and lineage of the family into modern era.
